overall_description: A high-polish yellow gold ring featuring a partial eternity band design with seven round brilliant-cut green gemstones (likely emeralds or tsavorites) held in a shared-prong setting with a scalloped gallery.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single isolated 3D model of an empty gold ring mounting without gemstones. The object is a ring shank that transitions into a setting area with seven empty circular seats for stones. Between each seat are vertical metal prongs standing upright. The side profile of the setting area features a scalloped, open gallery structure allowing light through. The bottom of the shank is a smooth, high-polish half-round band. Material is 18k yellow gold with a highly reflective metallic surface. The stone seats are recessed and clearly defined.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Product photography, macro lens, 3/4 perspective view, studio lighting, soft shadows, neutral gray background
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: gemstones, diamonds, green stones, scratches, matte finish, rustic, textured
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Isometric view showing both the shank and the top of the empty settings
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Softbox studio lighting to highlight the curvature of the gold and the depth of the empty stone seats

components.shape_description: Circular ring with D-profile shank transitioning to a linear array of circular baskets/seats
components.manufacturing_notes: Designed for investment casting (lost wax). Prongs must be cast longer than finished height to allow for setting. Shrinkage compensation of 1.5-2.5% required for gold casting.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single isolated round brilliant cut green gemstone. The object is a transparent emerald or tsavorite garnet. It features standard brilliant faceting: a flat octagonal table on top, triangular star facets, kite-shaped bezel facets, and a pointed culet at the bottom. The material is vitreous and transparent with deep green coloration and internal light refraction. The shape is a cone bottom with a faceted crown top. Sharp, precise geometric edges.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Macro gemology photography, ray-traced rendering, caustic lighting effects, isolated white background
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: metal, ring, gold, inclusions, cloudy, opaque, bezel
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Side profile view slightly elevated to show both crown and pavilion facets
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: High contrast lighting to emphasize refractive index and faceting structure

components.shape_description: Round Brilliant Cut (Cone with faceted top)
components.position: Set into the seats of Component 1
components.manufacturing_notes: Standard calibrated size (approx 3.0mm - 3.5mm). Requires careful handling during setting if using Emeralds due to Mohs hardness/brittleness.

additional_notes: The primary manufacturing complexity lies in the casting of the shared prongs; if they are too thin in the CAD/Wax stage, the metal flow may be insufficient. The stones are set manually after the metal component is cast and polished.
